item.title: Everquest 2 Review
item.description: Today Mobhunter offers a double-sized article: a full review of the first two weeks of Everquest 2.

item.title: November News Roundup
item.description: This week we take a look at some community news including the release of EQ2, some code changes, Caster's Realms's new administrator, and a few other odds and ends from around the net.

item.title: October 2004 Fan Faire Report
item.description: We return from New Orleans full of strange visions and fine tales to tell. Pull up a chair and listen to the stories of the future of Norrath.

item.title: Loral's Evil Halloween Agenda
item.description: Next week Loral travels to the strange lands of New Orleans. He travels with a satchel full of this Evil Agenda in the hopes of helping to manipulate Everquest to his own evil lands of darkness and horror. Read on...if you dare!

item.title: The Warts Under the Emperor's Clothes
item.description: It is a month after the release of Omens of War and the world of Norrath changed forever. While this expansion has many strengths, it also has a few weaknesses. This week we peek underneath the beautiful and ornate exterior to examine a few of the expansion's weaknesses.

item.title: The Myths of Class Balancing
item.description: This week we get away from some of the controversy surrounding our beloved game and go into the green pastures of a topic we can all enjoy and agree upon. I kid, of course. Lets roll up our sleeves and dig into the myths of class balance.

item.title: Interview with Scott Adams
item.description: This week it is my pleasure to interview Scott Adams. Scott and Pasty Loral dicuss Scott's mark on the computer game world, Scott's Everquest career, and Scott's EQ Wishlist.

item.title: Early October News
item.description: This week we relax from the onslaught of Lorals editorials for a more traditional look at the news.

item.title: After Omens
item.description: Today we take a look at the chaotic news of the last couple of weeks and we take a harder look at the Omens of War expeditions. If you look closely, you will see Loral flip flop again.

item.title: Omens of War Review
item.description: In this week's article we review the first week of Omens of War. We take a look at zones, levels, aas, gear, graphics, and the extra features Omens of War has to offer.

item.title: The Meaningless Words of Everquest
item.description: This week we discuss five meaningless and overused terms in the Everquest community. These five terms muddy the clear waters of communication and hide our true intent from the eyes of SOE. Remove them from your communications, replace them with detail, and we can finally express our true desires.

item.title: The Focus and the Flip Flop
item.description: Today we discuss the great foci change of '04 with a bit of discussion on the politics of language thrown in for a bit more flavor. An essay from 1946 probably doesn't count as a pop culture reference, but I'm working on it.

item.title: Visions and Omens
item.description: Our first exploration of Omens of War begins this week. We look at some of the new zones, new alternate advance abilities, and the task system. Promising times lay ahead.

item.title: Five Steps to One Million Subscribers
item.description: This week we look at what steps SOE might take to double Everquest subscribers. Improved retail versions, new PC graphics, another LDON expansion, a simpler interface, and improved stability can all lead SOE to a million Everquest subscribers and a better game for all of us.

item.title: The Calm Before the Storm
item.description: Today we deliver another gathering of news from across the lands and across the ethereal worlds of the net. We look at some new changes to test, some discussions of new LDON raids, and the continuing class issue updates.
